channel.title: [need help] Correct INSERT INTO syntax and use

item.title: [need help] Correct INSERT INTO syntax and use
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I was adding another row in my table through phpMyAdmin, and I finally found the proper code that worked for me. :o

"INSERT INTO `serverstatus` (`Name`, `IP`, `Port`) VALUES ('mopar', 'moparisthebest.com', '80')";

Otherwise, if anyone is interested in my actual script, it can be found here. Thank you again for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: [need help] Correct INSERT INTO syntax and use
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Besides your spelling/spacing mistakes in the first two queries you posted, they should work fine.

[php]“INSTERT INTO ‘serverstatus’ VALUES(‘mopar’, ‘moparisthebest.com’, ‘80’)”[/php]

That should work fine in the code sppt gave…in the query you posted along with your database structure, you were sending an additional value which may have messed it up (the 0 at the start)…unless the db structure you posted was incorrect).

Read full topic
item.source: [need help] Correct INSERT INTO syntax and use

item.title: [need help] Correct INSERT INTO syntax and use
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:4, topic:74202”][quote author=Mod Taharok link=topic=108937.msg1089061#msg1089061 date=1175670850]
[php]
$mysql_access = mysql_connect($Host, $User, $Password);
mysql_select_db ($DBName, $mysql_access);
$Query2 = “INSTERT INTO ‘serverstatus’ VALUES(0, ‘mopar’, ‘moparisthebest.com’, ‘80’)”;
mysql_query ($Query2, $mysql_access);
mysql_close($mysql_access);
[/php]

[/quote]
i prefer to do it like this:
[php]@mysql_connect($host, $user, $pass) or die(mysql_error());
@mysql_select_db($db) or die(mysql_error());
$query = mysql_query(“INSERT INTO serverstatus SET key=‘value’, and=‘so on’”);
mysql_close();//although not really required afaik
[/php][/quote]

Oi, that is a more unique way than what I have been seeing all over google. I will get back to you on whether or not that works. . .

Read full topic

mysql_select_db ($DBName, $mysql_access);
$Query2 = “INSTERT INTO ‘serverstatus’ VALUES(0, ‘mopar’, ‘moparisthebest.com’, ‘80’)”;
mysql_query ($Query2, $mysql_access);
mysql_close($mysql_access);
[/php][/quote]
i prefer to do it like this:
[php]@mysql_connect($host, $user, $pass) or die(mysql_error());
@mysql_select_db($db) or die(mysql_error());
$query = mysql_query(“INSERT INTO serverstatus SET key=‘value’, and=‘so on’”);

[/php]

item.title: [need help] Correct INSERT INTO syntax and use
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Yes, but with my inexperience in MYSQL databases, would it be normal just to use this to connect to a database with the following setup:

$mysql_access = mysql_connect($Host, $User, $Password);
mysql_select_db ($DBName, $mysql_access);
$Query2 = "INSTERT INTO 'serverstatus' VALUES(0, 'mopar', 'moparisthebest.com', '80')";
mysql_query ($Query2, $mysql_access);
mysql_close($mysql_access);
Name (my primary key) (varchar 20) (not null)
IP (varchar 50) (not null)
Port (varchar 6) (not null)

Read full topic

item.title: [need help] Correct INSERT INTO syntax and use
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Some PHP I wrote for a game registration.

[php]

Register! Login! <?php $register = $_POST['register']; if(empty($register)) { ?> 
  <p> Create a new account for Country Game! </p>
  <form action = "<?php $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] ?>" method="post">
    <label>Username: <input type="text" name="username" /></label><br />
    <label>Password: <input type="password" name="password" /></label><br />
    <label>Confirm Password: <input type="password" name="confirm" /></label><br />
	<input type="hidden" name="register" value="true" />
	<input type="submit" value="Register!"  /><br  />
  </form><?php 
  die();
}

$username = $_POST['username'];
$password = $_POST['password'];
$confirm = $_POST['confirm'];
$self = $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'];

if(empty($password)) {
	echo("You must have a password.\n");
	die("<a href=\"$self\">Click here to return</a>\n");
}
if(empty($username)) {
	echo("Please enter a username.\n");
	die("<a href=\"$self\">Click here to return</a>\n");
} 
if(empty($confirm)) {
	echo("Please confirm your password.\n");
	die("<a href=\"$self\">Click here to return</a>\n");
} 
if($confirm != $password) {
	echo("Your password and confirmed password don't match.\n");
	die("<a href=\"$self\">Click here to return</a>\n");
}

$mysql_link = mysql_connect("mysql", "*****", "******");	
mysql_select_db("*******");	

$checkexist = sprintf("SELECT user, pass FROM gam_login WHERE user='%s'", mysql_real_escape_string($username));
$exist = mysql_query($checkexist, $mysql_link);	
if (!$exist) {
	$message  = 'Invalid query: ' . mysql_error() . "\n";
	$message .= 'Whole query: ' . $query;
	die($message);
}
if(mysql_num_rows($exist)) {
	echo("That account name is already in use.");
	die("<a href=\"$self\">Click here to return</a>\n");
}		
echo("$res");				
$register = "INSERT into gam_login VALUES ( 0, SYSDATE(), '$username', '$password' )";
$res = mysql_query($register, $mysql_link);
if (!$res) {
	$message  = 'Invalid query: ' . mysql_error() . "\n";
	$message .= 'Whole query: ' . $query;
	die($message);
}
	
$verify = sprintf("SELECT user, pass FROM gam_login WHERE user='%s' AND pass='%s'",	
	mysql_real_escape_string($username), mysql_real_escape_string($password));
	
$result = mysql_query($verify, $mysql_link);
if (!$result) {
	$message  = 'Invalid query: ' . mysql_error() . "\n";
	$message .= 'Whole query: ' . $query;
	die($message);
}

if(mysql_num_rows($result)) die("Your account has been successfully created.");
die("Sorry, there was an error creating your account.");

mysql_close($mysql_link);

?>

[/php]

Make sure you actually have a link, have a database selected, and you actually run the query.

[php] $register = “INSERT into gam_login VALUES ( 0, SYSDATE(), ‘$username’, ‘$password’ )”;
$res = mysql_query($register, $mysql_link);[/php]

Works fine for me. Also a good idea to check for success.

Read full topic

item.title: [need help] Correct INSERT INTO syntax and use
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I have been trying to use this code for ages. Maybe my SQL databases are set up inproperly, maybe I am using the code wrong, or maybe it is having troubles connect. All I know is the several varriations that I have used and the access are not causing any parsing errors. Here is the basic syntax and use of this function that I have been using:

$Query2 = "INSERT INTO 'serverstatus'";
$Query 2 .= "VALUES ('mopar', 'moparisthebest.com', '80')";

And another use:

$Query2 = "INSTERT INTO 'serverstatus' VALUES('mopar', 'moparisthebest.com', '80')";

If you need more information on my script and/or the connection routine, please post about it. Or, if you have the direct answer to my struggling problem, that would be much beneficial to me finishing and possibly releasing (to those who actually desire it ;)) this script. Thank you for reading.

Read full topic
